item.title: Rural Telehealth and Education Enhancement Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commodity Markets, Digital Assets, and Rural Development.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

cdata.text:
Strengthening Telehealth and Education for Rural Communities Act of 2023

This bill reauthorizes through FY2028 and modifies the Distance Learning and Telemedicine Loan and Grant Program that is administered by the Department of Agriculture (USDA). The program supports telemedicine and distance learning services in rural areas through telecommunications, computer networks, and other advanced technology by students, teachers, medical professionals, and residents of rural areas.

The bill expands the scope of the program to specifically allow the use of program funds for operational expenses associated with telemedicine programs. It also allows the USDA to waive matching fund requirements in certain circumstances and requires USDA to set aside a specific amount of funding allotments for programs that focus on substance use disorder treatment or mental health services.

bill.title: Strengthening Telehealth and Education for Rural Communities Act of 2023

item.title: Strengthening Telehealth and Education for Rural Communities Act of 2023
Strengthening Telehealth and Education for Rural Communities Act of 2023
A bill to reauthorize the distance learning and telemedicine grant program, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
